Here are some suggestions for improving digestion:

1. Eat smaller, more frequent meals: Instead of consuming three large meals a day, try breaking them into 5-6 smaller meals to avoid overloading your digestive system.

2. Chew food thoroughly: Break down food properly and mix it with saliva, which has essential enzymes that facilitate good digestion.

3. Stay hydrated: Drinking enough water is crucial for proper digestion as it helps break down food and supports the absorption of nutrients.

4. Include fiber-rich foods in your diet: Fiber improves bowel movement and prevents constipation by adding bulk to stool â€“ include whole grains, fruits, vegetables, nuts/seeds in daily consumption.

5. Limit processed and fatty foods: Processed/fatty/ sugary items may strain the digestive system; reduce their intake or opt for healthier alternatives like lean meats/proteins/grains/fruits/vegetables etc., wherever possible.

6. Exercise regularly: Moderate exercise stimulates blood flow & oxygen supply throughout the body aiding efficient nutrient absorption/utilization - start with brisk walking/swimming/biking/dancing/yoga

7. Manage stress levels & practice relaxation techniques such as meditation/deep breathing exercises/mindfulness activities to maintain healthy gut functionality; mental wellbeing can influence gastric motility/functioning/gut-brain communication positively/negatively
